title: T206 SGC 50 Many For Sale / Trade
author: vintagetoppsguy

posts.post_title: T206 SGC 50 Many For Sale / Trade
posts.post_content:
I have something in my life coming up that will divert my attention away from my T206 set for a quite some time.  After some consideration, I have decided to continue to pursue the HOFers in the set, but not the complete set as I had once hoped to do.  All of the cards in my registry are for sale or for trade.  Most are Piedmont / Sweet Caporal, but there are also some Polar Bear, Sovereign, Cycle and Tolstoi.  

I really don't need the money so I prefer to trade the cards for T206 SGC HOFers or other pre-war HOF issues.  However, the cards are for sale as well.  In addition to pre-war, I would be willing to trade for vintage Topps baseball sets/lots/HOFers from '50s-'60s.  I'm open to any trade ideas, but in particular I am looking for '54 Topps Banks, Williams (both) Aaron, Kaline and Mays.  

Here is a link to my registry.  I will try to delete the cards as I move them.  I will use the valuation tool on T206.org for all sales / trades.

[url]http://www.sgccardregistry.com/set.aspx?cat=1&set=239&userset=4747[/url]

Back scan available upon request.
You are keeping the HOFers in that registry, correct?

[quote name="Chris D." post=846283]You are keeping the HOFers in that registry, correct?[/QUOTE]

That is correct.  Everything else is for sale / trade.

Here is what I have left.  Each card is $55 delivered with the exception of Mullin which is $125 due to print lines.

Bump to reflect the cards that have sold.  

Will take 10% off if you purchase 3 or more.

This will be my last bump on these this year.   I would like to finish any deals by early next week because I absolutely hate going to the post office during the holidays, and for this reason I purpose not to sell anything during the holiday season.

Please see post #6 above for the remaining cards.  Buy 3 or more and take 10% off.  Buy 5 or more and take 15% off.  All prices include delivery.  Also willing to trade.  Let's make a deal.
